intro: Mikaniopsis tedliei, commonly known as the Tedlie's mikaniopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and shrublands, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and delicate species.
